                    ### Question
                    Patients on isoniazid which vitamin deficiency is more likely to be seen.

                    ### Options
                    opa. Vitamin B9
opb. Vitamin B12
opc. Vitamin B6
opd. Vitamin B3

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Isoniazid use leads to an inhibition of pyridoxine kinase, reducing the activation of vitamin B6 and increasing the risk of vitamin B6 deficiency. This interaction is well-supported by evidence linking isoniazid with disruptions in pyridoxine metabolism. There is no substantial impact of isoniazid on the metabolism of vitamins B12, B9, or B3.
